formattedAddress: 422 E 72nd St, New York, NY 10021, USA
adrFormatAddress: 422 E 72nd St, New York, NY 10021, USA

originalText.text:
I am a first time mom that wanted to try a medication free vaginal delivery. I found this midwifery thank to a friend and my insurance. I worked really close with Risa and her midwives team ( I highly recommend them) All of them gave me recommendations and the type of care I was looking for.

When my labor started, I contacted the midwifery team and they immediately put me in touch with my midwife Sunny Soroosh. Sunny was checking my progress all the time over the phone until the contractions were strong enough and I decided to go to the hospital. Upon arrival Sunny received me, evaluated me and I was admitted to the hospital. Everything went according to plan. The atmosphere in my delivery room was familiar, private and harmonious. The entire team caring for me was respectful of my needs and desires which allowed me to relax and achieve a vaginal unmedicated delivery. 6 hours have passed and my beautiful daughter is ready to meet us, and in less than 15 minutes after the water broke my baby had come into the world. It was a physiological, natural and empowering birth for a woman like me (first time mom)

originalText.text: When Risa asked during our postpartum visit if I had time to reflect on my second birth with her, I told her yes and I could only say that it was amazing.  If you're  looking for someone to guide you through such a memorable period of your life and leave you feeling more empowered by it all, look no further than Risa. I am so thankful to her for two amazing pregnancies, births, and everything that comes after.  From nutrition to birth counseling to the perfect first latch, and the all important 4th trimester, Risa was there through it all not just for me but for my family. We love Risa and look forward to all the work she's leading to change maternal health outcomes for more families in NYC!

originalText.text:
About two months ago Risa worked with my wife to deliver our second child. She also delivered our first child 3 years ago. She's an amazing midwife who has been with us throughout this roller coaster ride, and we couldn't be happier.

As with the first pregnancy, Risa uses a holistic approach to childbirth that actually starts long before the baby is delivered. This includes nutrition, stress management, interpersonal relationships, and a wide range of other factors that impact the health of mother and baby. These aspects are often ignored by regular obstetricians, which is why we turned to Risa. Having been through two pregnancies with Risa, and having seen the results-- a natural birth with our preference and requests honored to the best extent possible-- we wholeheartedly recommend Risa.

One of the most important things to me was to make sure that my wife had her needs taken care of each step of the way, especially at the hospital when things could potentially get chaotic. When my wife went into labor this time around, we were in the middle of a global covid-19 pandemic, and this meant that hospital protocols were constantly shifting. Despite the situation, we approached ‘labor day’ without stress knowing Risa would be there to guide us. Risa kept us in the loop every step of the way. When it was finally time for our son to arrive, Risa was 100% in charge of the room and did everything in a way that advocated for my wife's needs. My wife was able deliver two healthy babies under Risa's care without any interventions needed. Even after the birth, we were able to lean on Risa’s support when health issues came up - she was always very responsive, just a phone call or text message away.

If you would like a natural birth with your preferences respected and your safety as your care provider's number one priority, then Risa is the midwife for you.

originalText.text: I transferred to Risa midway through my first pregnancy because I was looking for a different level of care and Risa did not disappoint. I got the individualized attention and education I needed as a first time mom to be.  During labor, Risa did everything in her power to make sure that I achieved the kind of birth I wanted, while ensuring the well-being of baby and mom. After the birth, Risa provided the reassuring support I needed to master breastfeeding. I am now in my third trimester of my second pregnancy and could not imagine working with anyone else.

originalText.text: Risa saved my birthing experience. I was unhappy with my doctor and hospital, and desperately switched to Risa on the 34th week of my first baby's pregnancy. It was the best decision I made and I only wished I was with Risa from earlier on.  She truly cares about the health and happiness of the mother, partner, and the baby, and shows full dedication, passion and professionalism towards supporting your journey from the day you meet her - she feels like family to us although we've only met with her a few times! Risa is extremely professional and knowledgable, and while her diet regimen for me (less carbs) was tough in my last weeks of pregnancy it was absolutely worth it. The birthing day was full of surprises, since while we had booked the Mt Sinai birthing center, when we rushed into the hospital with my baby already on her way out, we had to give birth in the operating room due to lack of any room openings. It seemed none of the nurses in the operating room were knowledgable of how to support a natural birth, and Risa magically put everyone's forces together to help with the process. She helped me stay calm and push through, and gave all her love and care to my baby. I feel so fortunate that Risa came into our lives and would love to work with her again if we do consider having another child!
